event.name: FINISH_BEACON_CIVILIAN
event.text: You've arrived at the Long-Range Beacon. When the FTL Drive is charged you can jump to the next Sector.

event.name: FINISH_BEACON_CIVILIAN_COREWORLDS
event.text: You've arrived at the Long-Range Beacon. When the FTL Drive is charged you can jump to the next Sector.

event.name: KESTREL_UNLOCK
event.text: As is customary in Union space, several corporate advertisements from the planet nearby play over your radio. You listen to them idly as you browse the nearby shipyards, gazing at various antique vessels. One in particular catches your eye, a Kestrel in seemingly full working order! You don't get to look at it very long though, when one of the advertisements catches your ear. It seems one from "Dewey Alms", CEO of Archive Incorporated, has an outgoing request for any capable mercenary vessel.
Your mission here is for the Federation, you can't be getting sidetracked with other mercenary work.

event.name: KESTREL_UNLOCK_OFFER
event.text: It seems these shipyards are in fact owned by Archive, so it's not difficult to get in touch with a correspondant who patches you in to Dewey directly. "Renegades? I have experience with your types. Before we begin, I would like to make it clear that, while I might be the CEO of Archive Inc., in this request I am not speaking on behalf of the company in any way. It would be... bad PR to get involved with more inter-dimensional renegades after the disaster of the 'Rusting Hulks' incident. I'm sure you understand."

"Good, good. Heh, don't worry. We aren't skirting the Union's laws or anything with this. I just don't want any backlash from a personal affair. As you may or may not already know, Archive specializes in the... well, archival of Antiquum Terrae (or as you might know it, Old Earth) technology and culture. This matter concerns one of my most prized antiques, a 23rd century 'Kasparov', the first FTL-capable ship produced by humankind. Originally made to transport passengers to and from Tau Ceti. A remarkable achievement... but she has been stolen by pirates! I can't gather why... sure, she marks a new age in exploration and discovery, but why would a pirate want such an outdated piece of technology?"

"But to who? Plenty of Kasparov's were made. This particular model would be of no interest to anyone but an avid historian or ship enthusiast like me. Never the matter. My request; hunt down those thieves and secure the Kasparov. I haven't in mind any particular reward, but I'm sure we can work something out. Name your price."

"Huh? That old thing? Oh, I can most certainly part ways with it. I jumped on purchasing one when they saw a sudden resurgence in popularity at the end of the Civil War, but now it seems everyone has one. Good deal then. One last thing - I've programmed the coordinates for the pirate ship into my assistant, Gana. He's just a machine, and not a very personable one at that, but he'll be sufficiently useful in combat. Best of luck captain. Godspeed!"
"You won't help then? What a loss... I'll have to find someone else then. Good day, captain."

choice.text: [Federation Database] What was the 'Rusting Hulks' incident?

surrender.text: "Christ! Stop, stop! You've caused enough damage! You one'a Wright's cronies? What the hell do you want?"

event.text: "That stupid ring ship? You were sent by Archive, weren't you! We don't have it anymore, alright? We were contracted to steal it for another collector!"

destroyed.text: The Brood ship has been destroyed... which means you won't be able to track down the 'Kasparov'. You've failed the mission, so it's best not to return to Dewey.

deadCrew.text: The Brood pirates have been killed... which means you won't be able to track down the 'Kasparov'. You've failed the mission, so it's best not to return to Dewey.

event.name: KESTREL_UNLOCK_PIRATE

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: You've tracked down the pirate ship at Gana's coordinates. Seems it's a Brood ship - you've heard about these, but you suspect Dewey intentionally left that little detail out of the job offer.
Remember - you need these guys to surrender to find the location of the 'Kasparov', so try not to kill them!

choice.text: We aren't picking a fight with the Brood.

event.text: You're sure there was something significant about this encounter, but it's too late now.

event.name: KESTREL_UNLOCK_QUEST_2
event.text: "I'm not saying! Oh, wait. You can literally kill me right now. Alright, fair game. We were hired by Hideo Tanaka, CEO of Hephaestus. I'm sure you've heard of him. He heard Archive had this big fancy ship called the 'Molotov' or... whatever. He didn't want anyone else to know he was stealing it though, so he hired us to do it. I've told you everything, now let us go!"

choice.text: One last thing - where is the ship now?

event.text: "Weren't you listening? It's at the nearby Hephaestus Shipyards. They're probably gonna break it down for transport or whatever." You manage to convince the pirates to hand you the coordinates, and watch as they jump away moments later. What a bunch of cowards.

destroyed.text: It seems the Hephaestus staff weren't kidding - they'd rather fight to the death than face the wrath of their boss.

deadCrew.text: It seems the Hephaestus staff weren't kidding - they'd rather fight to the death than face the wrath of their boss.

event.name: KESTREL_UNLOCK_RINGSHIP

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: You were suspicious of a trick at first, but this is definitely the right location. In the distance you can see what is definitely the Kasparov, and a small Hephaestus depot with which the 'Kasparov' is being inspected by. You catch some radio chatter between ships. "Yeah, boss says we gotta bring this 'Shakarov' thing to Mr. Tanaka's collection. God knows breaking this thing down is gonna suck, but if we screw up he's probably gonna sell us to Tiiikaka. Make sure there isn't a scratch on this or we're toast!"

choice.text: Demand they give back the Kasparov.

event.text: "What? Who the hell are you? Why are you here? Whadd'ya want with the 'Ivanov'?"

"Yeah yeah, Makogonov, shmakogonov. Oh, you're one of them MV people. With the fancy blue chemtrails or whatever. Archive sent you, didn't they? Look buddy, I don't care one bit about Alms's beef with Mr. Tanaka. But Tanaka is the one who pays the man who pays the man who pays the man who pays the man who pays me. So I ain't giving up this 'Shirov' thing without a fight, you hear?"

choice.text: Well, if it's a fight you want...

event.text: "Crap, we actually doing this? I shoulda known not to mention combat in front of a mercenary!"
You've come quite far - but this isn't worth it. You can't go picking fights with giga-corporations.

event.name: KESTREL_UNLOCK_QUEST_3
event.text: It seems most of the other ships were just automated construction drones. The depot's skeleton crew surrender, allowing you to secure the Kasparov and contact Dewey.

"Incredible! I shall see to it that your efforts do not go unpaid! I shall forward those Kestrel blueprints to you immediately. Oh, and if you still have Gana on you, feel free to keep him. He's better suited to a military vessel anyways. Before you go though, who did end up being the culprit?"

choice.text: Hideo Tanaka hired pirates to steal your ship for his collection.

event.text: "That old assbucket. I should have known. Hideo takes whatever he wants from anyone he wants, even a fellow Union megacorp. Oh well. As Grandfather would say... well Grandfather didn't say much. He mostly just talked about satellites. Anyways, I thank you for your services. Best of luck on the rest of your mission."

event.name: COREWORLDS_TRAFFIC
event.text: This beacon is heavily trafficked by tons of ships. Though your hails are drowned out and not a single ship responds, you suspect the Rebellion will struggle to track you amongst all of these ships.

event.name: COREWORLDS_FUEL_RIDICULOUS
event.text: A nearby refueling platform is selling resources at ridiculous prices. An automated message plays over the intercom. "Come aboard and shop with us! Just remember, our prices are final."

choice.text: (Mind Control) Convince them to lower the prices.
(Adv. Mind Control) Convince them to lower the prices.

event.text: You notice the prices marked on the holoscreen built into the store going down rapidly. You stop once you've reached prices that you prefer: completely free.

choice.text: The hell is this? Let's kill these stingy bastards.

event.text: These prices are practically theft. You attack the station.
You mute the looping message and continue on your way.

event.name: COREWORLDS_FUEL_RIDICULOUS_LOW
event.text: The civilians lower their prices to something much more reasonable. Maybe now it's worth a purchase?
You mute the looping message and continue on your way.

event.name: COREWORLDS_FREE_CREW
event.text: A civilian shuttle, severely damaged from a huge hull breach, desperately hails you. They explain that they barely managed to escape from a pirate. They need to transfer crew over to a different ship.

choice.text: (Rock Crew) Let them aboard but station your Rock as extra security.
(Boarding Drone) Let them aboard but station your drone as extra security.
(Adv. Sensors) Let them aboard but keep constant scans running on them.

event.text: You explain your mission is too important to be transporting civilians. They're clearly distressed but are powerless to do anything but accept this.
The civilians are extremely grateful for your help. After gathering all of their possessions and come aboard, they permit you to scrap their old ship.
The civilians are very thankful for your help. Most agree to be dropped off at the nearest station, but one of them finds themselves longing for some change. They offer to join your crew.

As the civilians come aboard, you notice one of them is carrying an unusually large weapon concealed by their robes. It may just be for self-defense, and calling them out as a threat could cause problems.

You point out the weapon, quickly drawing your blaster before they can do the same. The civilians panic, and they try to explain that the one in the robe is their bodyguard. You apologize but your rash actions have done their damage. The civilians reluctantly go into the cargo bay and refuse to speak to any of your crew until you drop them off at a nearby station, where they briefly thank you and leave as fast as possible.

You draw your laser and stare down the robed "civilian". The rest of the civilians and your crew do the same, and now you find yourself in a rather precarious situation. "Well then captain, I have to applaud you for figuring out this was a ruse. Give us some scrap and we'll be on our way. Otherwise, it's lights out for all-" You cut him off with a shot to the head. Chaos ensues and you prepare to defend the ship from the other pirates.
Luckily, nothing seems to come of it. You drop off the civilians at the nearest station, where they thank and pay you.

You've helped all of the civilians into the cargo-bay and begun to head back to the bridge when you hear the unmistakable sound of a teleporter. You run back to catch several of the "civilians" teleporting away with the contents of your storage. The remaining pirates prepare to fight.
The civilians are extremely grateful for your help. After gathering all of their possessions and come aboard, they permit you to scrap their old ship.
The civilians are very thankful for your help. Most agree to be dropped off at the nearest station, but one of them finds themselves longing for some change. They offer to join your crew.

The civilians begin to move aboard, but your security notices several of the civilians trying to smuggle weapons onboard. They drop their guns immediately and surrender. Seems this was an elaborate pirate trap! Considering they had no problem trying to rob you, you don't feel guilty at all extorting them for their stuff.

event.name: COREWORLDS_FREEMANTIS_LOST
event.text: You're contacted by a Free Mantis ship, piloted by a rather lost looking captain. "Oh, greating. You not yet run away, so I assume you friendly. We come here by mistake, looking for Federation sector to enroll in military. Now, we hunted by Militia. Very unfortunate. Think you could do favor and convince Militia we good?"

choice.text: Agree to track down the Militia ship hunting them.

event.text: "Much appreciate, friend." You follow their directions and find the Militia ship has already arrived in this system. They haven't noticed you.

"Yeah, what do you want?" You explain the Free Mantis ship they're hunting is only trying to pass through the sector peacefully. The Militia captain breaks into laughter. "HAH! You're joking. You have to be. If there was anything the Rebellion got right, it's that aliens are dangerous. They're filthy Mantis. You can't trust a word they say."
The Militia ship is bound to cave in if you can do enough damage to their hull. You ready the weapons.

Your Free Mantis walks onto the camera, waving with a big goofy grin. The Militiamen however, are not quite so pleased. "Ugh, you have one of the insectoid freaks on your SHIP?! That's repulsive! For what did all those men and women die for in the Fed-Mantis war if we're just letting the Mantis work alongside us now? You are the reason this galaxy, hell, this Multiverse has gone to shit." They end the call immediately and attack!
"Ugh, fine. You're really determined to save these Mantis freaks. Just hope they don't get into any trouble or we'll have no choice but to kill them."

choice.text: Go back to the Free Mantis.

event.text: "Many thanks! You have done great favor for us. We in debt to you captain. How can repay you?"
The Free Mantis aren't very good at repairs, but they all work together and manage to repair a decent portion of your hull.
The Free Mantis transfer over some fuel.
The Free Mantis gladly hand over a portion of their scrap stores to you.
If you've learned anything on your mission, it's that the best way to deal with problems is through brutal murder. You power up the weapons and prepare to destroy the Militia ship.
"Ah. Very well. Best luck on mission!"

event.name: COREWORLDS_FREEMANTIS_LOST_WIN
event.text: You've killed the Militia ship. You've saved the Free Mantis for now, and scrap the remains of the Militia ship.

choice.text: Go back to the Free Mantis.

event.text: "You... you kill them? W-why? That unnecessary. We not want dead civilians. We just want safe travels. Still... you save us. I pay you as thanks, but hope you not do this in future."

event.name: COREWORLDS_FREEMANTIS_LOST_SURRENDER
event.text: The Militia ship is near destruction. The captain looks at you desperately. "What... are you serious? You're going to kill us for some bloody Mantis?"

choice.text: Let the Free Mantis go and we'll spare you.

event.text: "Jeez, you people are insane. But fine, we'll let them through. Damn senator starts accepting refugees and suddenly we're killing each other just to let these assholes into our homes..."

choice.text: Go back to the Free Mantis.

event.text: "Many thanks! You have done great favor for us. We in debt to you captain. How can repay you?"
The Free Mantis aren't very good at repairs, but they all work together and manage to repair a decent portion of your hull.
The Free Mantis transfer over some fuel.
The Free Mantis gladly hand over a portion of their scrap stores to you.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_MILITIA_COREWORLDS
textList.text: The wreckage of a civilian ship drift nearby, but before you can even think to salvage some of it, a Militia ship mistakes you as the attacker and prepares to avenge the civilians.
You get into some trouble over your identification with the Militia ship at this beacon, and not long after things get heated to the point of conflict!
The Militiamen at this beacon seem to mistake one of your crew as an infamous pirate with a heavy bounty. Not about to hand over your crew, you prepare to fight.
You try not to get into fights with civilians, but sometimes the civilians get into fights with you. Somehow you've angered the Militia ship here, and it's already moving in to attack.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_PIRATE_STATION_COREWORLDS
event.text: The Civilian station is no friend of yours. Now inhabited by pirates, it's aiming its entire arsenal straight at you.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_COALITION_COREWORLDS
event.text: A Coalition ship is slinking around the area, no doubt hunting for civilians. Spotting you instead, it decides you'll be a nice challenge for it and attacks.

event.name: COREWORLDS_MINING_OPS
event.text: It appears a civilian mining operation is being held in an asteroid field nearby.
Most of the ships have docked with a nearby outpost out of reach of the asteroid field, but one ship is still in the progress of mining some asteroids.
You move in to attack the mining ship.

choice.text: (Mining Equipment) Mine some of the asteroids on the outskirts.

event.text: You gather a decent supply of fuel and scrap from the asteroids when suddenly the harvester from earlier spots you. "Hey! This is a restricted area! What the hell are you doing?" With no one else to defend the asteroid field, they have no choice but to fight you off!

choice.text: (Beam Drone) Mine some of the asteroids on the outskirts. [-1|]

event.text: You gather a decent supply of fuel and scrap from the asteroids when suddenly the harvester from earlier spots you. "Hey! This is a restricted area! What the hell are you doing?" With no one else to defend the asteroid field, they have no choice but to fight you off!

choice.text: (Scrap Arm) Mine some of the asteroids on the outskirts.

event.text: You gather a decent supply of fuel and scrap from the asteroids when suddenly the harvester from earlier spots you. "Hey! This is a restricted area! What the hell are you doing?" With no one else to defend the asteroid field, they have no choice but to fight you off!
You have no interest in the mining operation.

event.name: COREWORLDS_MINING_OPS_DESTROY
event.text: It appears the mining ship was carrying large fuel stores. One of your shots must have ignited the cargo bay, because the mining ship explodes. Luckily your ship isn't harmed, but none of their cargo survived. You quickly scrap what's left before reinforcements arrive.

event.name: COREWORLDS_MINING_OPS_KILL
event.text: With the mining ship crew dead, you find large stores of fuel onboard.

event.name: COREWORLDS_WEAPON_FACTORY
event.text: A small partially automated weapon factory lies in the distance. It's protected by a single Militia ship.

choice.text: Attack the guard to get to the factory.

event.text: You prepare to attack the Militia ship.

choice.text: (Forged ID) Pretend to be a Rebel requisition officer.

event.text: The Militia ship doesn't seem terribly happy with your presence. "The Union does not serve Rebel scum. Or at least, we shouldn't. What happened to the glory days of the Federation, when you orange assholes didn't accost the innocent?"
You have no interest in the factory.

event.name: COREWORLDS_WEAPON_FACTORY_CHOICE
event.text: Without the guard to protect them, the few Civilian workers scatter. You have the factory all to yourself, but it won't be long until reinforcements arrive. What will you grab?

event.name: COREWORLDS_SUZERAIN_CARAVAN
event.text: It's extremely rare to see a Suzerain ship outside of the Mantis Hive, but even more so in Union territory. One particularly brave Suzerain ship is attacking a Militia caravan. The escort is poorly equipped and hardly stands a chance.
You prepare to attack the Suzerain ship.

choice.text: (Cloaking) Cloak and rob the Transport while they're distracted.

event.text: The Militiamen hardly even realized what happened before you've made away with some supplies. They're too busy with the Mantis to stop you, so you get away scot-free.

choice.text: (Hive Elite) Demand the Suzerain ship stand down.

event.text: Your Mantis berates the Suzerain captain for leaving their territory unprotected to do silly things like "robbing meatsacks." Despite the irony of this, the Suzerain aboard the enemy ship seems ashamed and jumps away. The Militia ships offer a reward, but one of their guards offers his services to you, afraid the Suzerains might return and attack the caravan after you leave.

choice.text: (Flares) Use the flares to lure the Suzerain away from the caravan.

event.text: The Suzerain almost immediately spots the flares and diverts, assuming it's a distress call sent to another nearby vessel. While they're distracted, you escort the Militia ships away. Seems they took quite the hit from the attack, and along with their reward one of the Militia guards offers his services to you, not wanting to risk facing the Suzerains again on the remainder of the trip.
It's a hard choice, but messing with a Suzerain is not something you look forward to doing.

event.name: COREWORLDS_SUZERAIN_CARAVAN_GIFT
event.text: The escort ship took a lot more damage than you first realized. Their life support failed during the fight and their crew asphyxiated. Luckily, the transport is still alive, and they give you some of their cargo as thanks.

event.name: COREWORLDS_EARTH

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: This is Earth, the Homeworld of the Human race.

event.text: You've discovered a planet all too familiar. It's Antiquum Terrae, more often referred to as Old Earth, the homeworld and origin of the Human race! Though most of the planet has flooded, a few large and densely populated cities remain.

On the planet's surface is a museum and large memorial park. The ship computer informs you the subject matter involves the Mantis invasion of Earth. Attendance is free but it'll likely take a lot of time to browse the place.
You land on a large platform and exit the ship. You take a long stroll through the park and come across several plaques detailing things about the war. One in particular stands out to you.

"It all looked bleak for the citizens of Earth until the creation of the very first Pre-Igniter tech, invented by Jackson Newman. This augment was then merged with a powerful laser model developed by Zulfiqar Armaments, a busy corporation that has since grown to be very wealthy and powerful in modern times. Though the weapon was once considered a super-weapon so long ago, it is likely it would still stand the test of time and be very efficient in modern combat."

As you keep reading, you notice a section describing the locations of the parts of the weapon. "After the war was over the weapon was dismantled and many of the parts were repossessed." Maybe if you can track down their locations, you can re-assemble the gun!

choice.text: Read on the location of the barrel.

event.text: "The first part, the barrel, was originally given to a man by the name of Alaster Williams before it was stolen by a Mantis warlord and passed down across many generations. It is a valuable heirloom in their family, and it is highly unlikely they would surrender it to anyone, especially those who defeated them in the war."

choice.text: Read on the location of the base.

event.text: "The second part, the base, was buried alongside the creator of the weapon and its tech. The gravesite is among those of every soldier lost to the Mantis invasions."

choice.text: Read on the location of the Pre-Igniter.

event.text: "The final part, the Pre-Igniter was stolen by a Smuggler. It has been circulating the black market for many years, repossessed many times. Though it would serve as a valuable collectors item, the augment itself is told to no longer function as intended due to years of misuse by pirates."
With all of the information you need to collect the parts, you hurry back to the ship.

choice.text: We don't have time for wild goose chases around the sector.

event.text: You don't have time to go learning history. You pull away from the planet.

event.name: QUEST_GATLING_BARREL

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: This is the location of the Gatling Barrel.

event.text: You have arrived at a busy Mantis warcamp on a small moon. Several ships lay on the surface, the largest being a Suzerain and no doubt where the Gatling barrel is held.

choice.text: Hail them and try to negotiate.

event.text: A Mantis with a long scar running down their face responds. "Yes? What reason has ship called me?"

choice.text: We've come for the Gatling Barrel.

event.text: "What? You mean spinny stick? You not dare take spinny stick! Precious heirloom passed down from grandfather, not plaything of stupid Federation captain!"

choice.text: Then we'll have to take it!

event.text: The Mantis shrieks and ends the call, and the Suzerain ship comes to life. It rises to meet you. If you had to guess, the 'spinny stick' is kept on that ship and you'll have to empty it of crew to get it.
"No! No! No! Not care who are! Shoo! Not welcome here." Despite the Mantis's tantrum, the only option that remains is to take it from him.

The Mantis shrieks and ends the call, and the Suzerain ship comes to life. It rises to meet you. If you had to guess, the 'spinny stick' is kept on that ship and you'll have to empty it of crew to get it.

choice.text: This is risky, we should leave.

event.text: You decide against pulling closer to the camp and stay far away from the moon.

event.name: QUEST_GATLING_BASE

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: This is the location of the Gatling Base.

event.text: The graveyard at this beacon isn't quite what you expected. Rather than a spooky field or dark and stormy swamp planet, it appears to be a nice flat patch of grass decorated with the tombs of the fallen soldiers. You aren't sure if you really want to go grave robbing these people.

choice.text: We have a war of our own to fight. If these people were alive, they'd understand.

event.text: You inspect the gravesite and realise there's nothing to suggest where the Gatling Gun might be buried. You pick out a few graves that sound familiar, but you aren't sure which one. You think the plaque said who it was, but you'll have to remember who.

You start digging, but all you find inside is a rotting corpse. Disgusted and disappointed, you prepare to leave, when an Elite Federation ship swings by and spots you in the act. "Assholes! You'd dare dishonour the heroes buried here?" They raise their weapons and attack!
You start digging to find that you were correct! Inside the grave is the Gatling Base! You have your crew haul it back to the ship.
As you're leaving, a Federation Elite flies past, spotting you in the process! "Assholes! You'd dare dishonour the heroes buried here?" They raise their weapons and attack!

You start digging, but all you find inside is a rotting corpse. Disgusted and disappointed, you prepare to leave, when an Elite Federation ship swings by and spots you in the act. "Assholes! You'd dare dishonour the heroes buried here?" They raise their weapons and attack!

You start digging, but all you find inside is a rotting corpse. Disgusted and disappointed, you prepare to leave, when an Elite Federation ship swings by and spots you in the act. "Assholes! You'd dare dishonour the heroes buried here?" They raise their weapons and attack!

choice.text: We have better things to do than dishonouring the dead.

event.text: You ignore the graveyard and fly away.

event.name: QUEST_GATLING_AUGMENT

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: This is the location of the Pre-Igniter tech.

event.text: You spot an armoured Smuggler Station orbiting the beacon, soliciting to a few smaller ships. It's surprising they can operate here despite the swarms of militiamen protecting the beacon, but this is the place you're looking for.

You hail the Smugglers and explain the situation. The captain gives a wheezy chuckle at your explanation. "Is that so now? Well I've been struggling to get rid of this crap for a while now, and at last I found someone willing to pay a price for it! Hell, I'll ever offer you a special 'Jumbo Deal' with some extra supplies for only a minor price increase!"

choice.text: Buy the "Jumbo Deal" along with the Pre-Igniter.

event.text: You aren't going to pay these smugglers anything! You raise the weapons and attack. The other few ships shopping scatter as you approach the station.
You ignore the station and fly away.

textList.name: MILITIA_FREE_AMMO
textList.text: Nearby drifts the burnt husk of what surely was once a Militia transport. Little remains other than a single crate of ammunition.

You notice a mine drifting nearby, followed by several more. Most, if not all, are inactive, probably left over from some sort of training exercise. Fortunately, this means you can salvage them with relative ease.
A small refuelling drone flies past, stops, then returns to scan your ship. It identifies you as friendly and restocks your ammo supply free of charge before speeding off again.

event.name: MILITIA_CLANSMEN
event.text: You receive a hail from a Slug ship hiding behind a small moon. Upon closer inspection, it's clear the ship is staffed by Slug Clansmen, belonging to the Exotic Hunter's Guild.

"A fine sssship for a Multiverssse Traveller! When we heard the Militia accepted any sssspeciesss among their ranksss, I realizzzed what an excccellent opportunity it would be to go hunting! But sssince you're here, perhapsss you have some sssspecimenss to donate? We will pay very well!"

choice.text: Draw straws and give a crew to the Slugs.

event.text: The Slugs take your crew back to their ship kicking and screaming. "Thiss one will make an exccccellent trophy! Sssome ssscrap for you, good ssssir."

removeCrew.text: Though your crew will likely be dead soon, you don't think cloning them is a good idea after you just gave them up to murderous hunters.

choice.text: (Clansman Crew) Claim to be hunters yourself.

event.text: "Ahh, another hunter? To think I thought I wasss the firsssst with thisss idea... Oooh, your sssship isss ssso much larger than mine. You probably have ssso much more ssssuccesss!" The Slug offers his services. Hopefully he doesn't mind hunting Rebels.

choice.text: (Improved Armories) Claim to be hunters yourself.

event.text: "Ahh, another hunter? To think I thought I wasss the firsssst with thisss idea... Oooh, your sssship isss ssso much larger than mine. You probably have ssso much more ssssuccesss!" The Slug offers his services. Hopefully he doesn't mind hunting Rebels.
You engage the Clansmen.
"A ssshame. I alwayssss try to be polite firssst, but people rarely agree. Oh well, thissss will be a lot more fun now!"
"Ssssquares." The Clansmen jump away.

event.name: MILITIA_AUTOGRAPHS
event.text: In the distance is a densely populated planet under Militia control, with plenty of traffic to and from. You can likely find a market on the surface.

Near minutes after landing on the planet's surface you're swarmed by both Civilians, Federation officers, and Militia recruits. It appears they recognize you as a Multiverse Renegade, and are overtaken by stardom. Apparently it's rare to see ships like yours here.

choice.text: Ignore the fans and find a store.

event.text: You push past the crowds, apologizing to them as you go, and eventually find a market to shop at.

choice.text: Sign some autographs, but leave before the fleet can catch up.

event.text: You decide to stick around with the crowd, telling stories and signing autographs. You even receive some gifts, but eventually decide to get going before the Rebels can arrive.

choice.text: Stay back for a while with the fans.

event.text: You decide to stick around with the crowd, telling stories and signing autographs. The longer you stay the more gifts you're showered with, but eventually you have to call it quits before the Rebels can catch up any more.

choice.text: We don't need to go shopping right now.

event.text: You fly past the planet.

event.name: MILITIA_TEXTWALL
event.text: A Zoltan Peacekeeper is stationed nearby, speaking with several Militia ships. Eventually, all of the ships but the Zoltan jump away, and you receive a hail.

"Oh, hello. I am Bolin, a Zoltan soldier for the Militia Corps. I've been working hard on a speech that I intend to share during the next meeting of the Galactic Union, but no one wants to listen to it or give me feedback. Would you mind if I shared them with you?"
"Wonderful! I shall now begin." Bolin pulls out a massive book, slamming it down on the desk in front of him and pulls open the cover. He clears his throat, and begins to read...
"As I expected... carry on then..."

event.name: MILITIA_TEXTWALL_TEXT
event.text: "My fellow citizens of the Galactic Union, subsidiary of the United Federation and regulator of laws in Union territory, I have come to speak with you about a very important matter. Since the dawn of civilization we have been creatures bound to our weapons of war. Every race, Human, Zoltan, Aquarian, Rockman, Mantis, even Engi or Orchid, we have all waged wars not just against each other, but ourselves. It is beyond many of us, unthinkable even, to surrender these tools of destruction... nay, these evil and wicked thoughts that plague our civilizations. We say we wish to evolve, learn and grow, but how can we do this when we still hold so dear to us the ideas of revenge and hatred?"

"To emphasize my point, let me tell you all a story. Back during the infamous Mantis - Human war, a time when the seeds of thought that would grow to be the Federation had only just barely been planted, the Human people were in dire straits. The far more dangerous and warrior-like creatures that were the Mantis caused havoc among the unprepared human colonies. The Humans turned to the only allies they had at the time, the Engi, hoping for assistance. The Engi reluctantly accepted, but only in turn if the humans would liberate the slaves from the Mantis war camps. The two forces fought for years and years for control over the neighbouring planet Mars, which the Mantis had managed to secure as a stronghold and key point for planning their invasion. Rather than negotiating for a ceasefire, or surrendering, the human people continued to fight the Mantis to near extinction. The Mantis would show the humans no mercy either, and would not stop until humanity had been eradicated."

Bolin clears his throat, and flips through a few pages, confused. "The uh... The Mantis are not the only violent race known to have staged such terrible wars. The Rock Inquisitions are perhaps some of the worst battles known to the galaxy. Believing themselves to be superior, the Rockmen sent forth battalions of armored ships staffed by trained soldiers known as the Crusaders to claim other territory in the name of the holy Rock Theocracy. The Chrysolic Faith that drove the Rockmen to such violence was the very same used by the Rock Elders to enslave their population through tactics of fear. Clearly an immoral action, it is known to many that the Rock dictatorship is perhaps one of the most violent and unforgiving forces in the galaxy."

"The religious persecution of the Rockmen government is not the only example of uh... of barbarianism leading to unjust treatment of other races. Going back to the Mantis, the Mantis race has for many years enslaved the Engi race for usage of their excellency at repairs. The Mantis race, due to their anatomy, are often incapable of performing precise work with electronics, though their claws have been known to function in place of screwdrivers or other tools from time to time. It is interesting to compare the differences between the two functionally opposite races. Similar duality is not often seen, though some have commented on the benefits of mixing Orchid and Rockmen crew together, due to the fire-proof nature of the Rockmen because of their hard, though not actually rock, exterior."

"However, it also stands to say that the Orchids may actually function better with the Shells, who's reliance on oxygen naturally would pair them with the plant beings. It is a scientific wonder how a single Orchid is capable of effectively replacing a life support system for extended periods of time. Many biologists, many of which coincidentally also happen to be Shells, have attempted to study Orchid biology. For those of you who might not be aware, the Shell race has placed a heavy focus on scientific study, even occasionally abducting tourists or visiting ships to run quick, albeit painless, tests. This has led to many cultural misunderstandings with the less understanding species, such as the Rockmen or Mantis. The Slugs also have a particular interest in the Shells, though not for any innocent reasons. A clan of Slug hobbyists known as the Exotic Hunters Guild has formed, whose specific purpose is to hunt rare or sapient creatures. The Shells are their prime targets, because of their armored abilities."

"Frighteningly, the attacks lead by the EHG, that being the aforementioned Exotic Hunters Guild for any of those not paying attention, are near synonymous with the earlier but still relatively recent series of conflicts known as the Slug Expansion Wars. I'm sure many of you here are already aware of the history of the Slug Expansion Wars, but I will share a brief summary of the conflicts for those of you who aren't."

Bolin licks the page and flips to the next. He coughs slightly, pounds on his chest, and continues to read. "Starting after the Rebellion's rise to power, the Federation forces were dedicated to clearing out Rebel ships from their territory. This left much of space unprotected from invaders. The Slugs, who had previously been shunned from the Federation for their traitorous nature, took notice to this pattern and began planning a mass migration to new territory. Though they started with nebulous sectors, they soon found themselves courageous enough to attack clear sectors, sometimes even already occupied space. This came to cause issues when the Slugs dared invade Mantis and Rock space, much to the reasonable displeasure of those governments. Both the Hive and Elders declared war on the Slugs, and so they fought for several years. Eventually, the Slugs surrendered and offered back territory. They didn't stop there however, and even offered some of their original territory up as well. This eventually evolved into an alliance that we have come to know as the Coalition."
"This lack of Federation protection over Union space also led to the rise of the Militia. However, I will spare you all this tale, as I know everyone here is for certain familiar with the story."

"I WILL however tell the story of the Coalition, in case you might not be aware. The Coalition is a truce between the Sethnian Kleptocracy, the Urtharean Theocracy, the Yeitiiik Hive, and the Eargen Republic. These 4 races are perhaps some of the most hostile and deadly in the galaxy, and this alliance has caused fear for both the Federation and Rebellion. The Coalition continues to grow in power, and even occupies several of its own sectors. The Coalition has also taken usage of Slug Cealaforming tech, a method of transporting nebulous gases to create artificial nebulas. Though these fake clouds are incapable of forming into stars, they still cause sensors to malfunction and can even generate the same electrical currents as ion storms, a deepspace hazard I'm sure any pilots here are definitely familiar with if you've ever been to a nebula sector."

"Cealaforming is not the only unique tech developed by the Slugs however. Many Slugs take use of Anti-Bio weaponry, which often used to be confused with Particle tech because of their similar orange colors, at least before Anti-Bio weaponry was transitioned to pink. Particle tech was actually developed by the Zoltan race on accident in junction with The Zufquair Corporation. Uh... wait no, that's spelled wrong."

"Wait... is it Zluficar? Zultifigar? I know it starts with a Z..." Bolin flips back through his text, searching for something. "Ah, I spelled it right here. Zulfiqar, thats it. Now, where was I... Oh, damn I lost my page. Do you uh, do you want me to start again?"
Bolin awaits your response.
"Ok, if you say so!" Bolin flips back to page one. "From the top then."
"Oh, ok. Fair enough!" Bolin flips the book closed. "Thanks for listening that far at least. So uh, what did you think?"

"Really? You liked it? Amazing! Thank you so much for your feedback. Oh man, no one has ever said anything nice about my speech before, not even my own crew! Hey uh, what if I joined yours? You seem much nicer, and maybe with your encouragement I can even finish this draft in time to present it!"

choice.text: Dear god that was the biggest waste of time in my life.

event.text: Bolin looks down at his feet in shame. "Oh... ok." He cuts comms. You probably didn't have to be so rude, but at least you don't have to listen to him ramble any longer.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_MILITIA
textList.text: The wreckage of a civilian ship drift nearby, but before you can even think to salvage some of it, a Militia ship mistakes you as the attacker and prepares to avenge the civilians.
You get into some trouble over your identification with the Militia ship at this beacon, and not long after things get heated to the point of conflict!
The Militiamen at this beacon seem to mistake one of your crew as an infamous pirate with a heavy bounty. Not about to hand over your crew, you prepare to fight.
You try not to get into fights with civilians, but sometimes the civilians get into fights with you. Somehow you've angered the Militia ship here, and it's already moving in to attack.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_MILITIA_STATION
event.text: You run into a Militia station near this beacon, who refuses to let you past. Apparently this beacon requires a toll to pass through.
The Militia station wastes no time with conversation - the second you refuse their weapons come online!
The Militia station collects the payment and allows you to continue.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_MILITIA_ELITE
event.text: The CDEG vessels are some of the deadliest in the Militia fleet, and for good reason. Boasting highly trained crew, these ships don't mess around in combat. Unfortunately for you, the ship here deems you a threat and attacks!

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_PIRATE_MILITIA
textList.text: It takes a bold pirate captain - or a stupid one - to try and invade Militia space. When you notice the hostile ship approaching, you hope they're the latter as you prepare for combat.
A pirate vessel approaches, weapons already charging. They must be on quite the killing spree in this territory, and they're ready to take a break from Militia ships and fight yours!
It's ironic what a pirate problem Militia territory suffers from despite the heavy militarization here. No one will miss the ship here once you've killed them.
"Hah, I bet you expected a Militia vessel! Now you surely cower in your boots at the sight of my ship, yes?" You mute his comms mid-monologue and prepare to fight.
You catch the glimpse of purple fly past. Not long after, a pirate ship comes into view. "Haha! I have claimed the lives of many Militiamen, and now I shall claim yours! Prepare to fight!"

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_PIRATE_MILITIA_ONLY
textList.text: The Militia fleet boasts a large amount of ships, but this also makes them a prime target for pirates in need of a new ride. A pirate controlled Militia ship approaches, weapons blazing.
A pirate ship, looking to test out the new gear they just stole from the Militia, locks onto your ship and attacks!
At first you assume the ship here is just another ordinary Militia ship, until you see the pirate paint decorating its hull. Pirates inbound!

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_REBEL_MILITIA
textList.text: "The Rebellion shall never cease! All who ally with the Federation will be killed!" You doubt the moral superiority of murdering civilians only trying to protect their sectors, but if the Rebels want a fight, a fight they will get.

The Rebellion seem to hold a grudge against the Militia, though you can't imagine why. The Rebel ship here seems hell-bent on a fight, and since you're the only ship here they decide you will be a satisfactory opponent.
A Rebel ship has picked clean the remains of a Militia station. Nearly seconds after you jump in they spot you and decide to make you their next target.

The Militia tries hard to keep this sector clear of Rebel forces, but their defenses are incapable of keeping all of them out. A Rebel forward scout that has found their way into the sector spots you and attacks.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_MILITIA_ESCORT
event.text: The ruins of what was once a Militia transport drift nearby. A Militia escort, their crew confused and afraid, mistake you for the attackers and prepare to defend themselves! You try to hail them but they won't respond, and it looks like the only way out of this is with a fight.
You power up the weapons and attack the Militiamen.
You fly past the Militia vessel.

textList.name: TEXT_MILITIA_CHOICE
textList.text: A Militia vessel is making small repairs to their hull after a fight. No other ships are nearby.
You notice another ship, belonging to the Militia, drifting some distance away. The ship is fully functional but politely declines any hails.
A decently armed Militia vessel is patrolling the beacon. Because of your Federation status, they don't mind you.

event.name: MILITIA_DEPOT
event.text: Nearby you notice a Militia station offering supplies to travellers.

choice.text: Submit your ID and get some supplies.
Attack, surely we can get more from them!

event.text: You power up the weapons and attack the Militiamen.
You ignore the Militia station.

event.name: MILITIA_TRAINIES
event.text: A Militia training exercise appears to be going down at this beacon. Fortunately, they aren't aiming to kill and are a safe distance away from the beacon.

choice.text: Hail and see if you can get involved.

event.text: The leading commander of the squad responds. "You want to participate in the training? Go ahead, damaging the hull is fine but just be careful you don't kill anyone! We'll end the exercise after 60 seconds."

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: The training exercize will end in this much time. Make sure not to kill anyone until then!

event.text: You ignore the Militia station.

event.name: MILITIA_TRAINIES_KILL
event.text: Seems you accidentally took the training too far, and now there's blood on your hands. It takes a moment for the other ships to realize what's happening, but as soon as they realize you've killed their friends, they immediately abandon the exercise and fire at you. Your hull takes some damage, but you're able to fly away in time.

event.name: MILITIA_TRAINIES_WIN
event.text: The commander contacts you in person once the other ships disperse. "Thank you for your help! These are some of our newest recruits, they have little experience in actual combat. I'm sure going up against an actual Multiverse Renegade was quite the experience for them! I don't have much supplies to give you, but here's a combat augment we use for training, maybe you can find use in it."

event.name: MILITIA_RECRUITMENT
event.text: A Rebel ship has docked with a Militia recruitment center stationed at this beacon. Quick scans show the Rebels have taken the Militiamen hostage.
You power up the weapons and attack the Rebels.

choice.text: Contact the Rebels; try to talk them out of it.
(Improved Cloaking) Cloak and scrap some of the Rebel ships while they're aboard.

event.text: With the Rebels occupied, there's no one around to guard their ships. Under the veil of your cloak you tear off some of the plating and leave quickly.

choice.text: (Monk Crew) Shame the Rebels for their violent ways.

event.text: Your Monk spends the next 30 minutes insulting the Rebels for their barbaric ways, attacking men only doing their duty by defending civilians. The Rebels are so ashamed of themselves several crumple to the floor sobbing. One particularly moved individual offers to join your crew, and the rest agree to leave the Militiamen alone.

choice.text: (Forged ID) Impersonate a Rebel and rescue the Militiamen.

event.text: You fly the ship closer and hail the Rebels inside, putting on the act of a Rebel officer. With your ID card you convince them you're really a Rebel vessel and get them to transfer some of the Militia soldiers to you. Once you've gained a safe distance, you reveal your true identity to the relieved Militiamen.

Seeing your crew armed to the teeth immediately puts the Rebels into panic, as they seemingly only expected underpaid Militia vessels to try and rescue the station. They surrender and let the Militiamen free. Most stay behind to handle the Rebels, but one soldier wishes to join you!
You fly past the Militia center. Hopefully, the situation will be resolved... no thanks to you.
The Rebels don't bother listening to you. They send over a team of crew to board you while you fight their ship.

The Rebels take a step back to listen to your speech. You assume it's not going to work, until they set down their weapons. Ashamed of attacking civilians, they head back to their ship and depart from the station. The Militiamen thank you and pay you for assisting them.

event.name: DISTRESS_MILITIA_KERNALS
event.text: The source of the distress beacon appears to be an Orchid merchant under attack by a pirate vessel! Should we assist?
You power up the weapons and engage the pirate vessel.
Orchid ships are considerably well armed, so you hope that they'll be able to save themselves.

event.name: MILITIA_KERNALS_SAVE
event.text: The Orchids thank you for your assistance. They explain that they were sent to sell their Kernel weapons to the Militia vessels in this sector. As payment for your help, they offer one for free.

event.name: DISTRESS_MILITIA_OUTPOST
event.text: The distress beacon's source is a small Militia outpost under attack by pirates. The Militiamen don't appear to be holding out well.
You power up the weapons and engage the pirate vessel.
"Hey, who the hell do you think you are- oh crap. Okay okay you win, have fun!" The pirate jumps away. The fatigued Militia station seems defenseless against anything you might try.
"Thank you, it was unlikely we'd have survived that pirate attack otherwise. We cannot offer much other than some fuel that we don't need."

choice.text: Demand they surrender one of their crew as a slave.

event.text: The Militiamen have few option but to give in to your demands.

choice.text: Destroy the station and loot the remains.

event.text: As you expected, the Militia outpost barely defends itself and is destroyed quickly.
You decide not to fight the pirates.

event.name: MILITIA_AUTOSEARCH
event.text: You notice two Militia ships nearby squabbling over something. You aren't sure what without listening closer, but it seems to pertain to Auto-ships.

"Huh? Oh, I didn't notice there was another ship here. We're discussing the possibility of constructing our own fleet of Militia Auto-ships to reduce the number of casualties on the front-lines. But before we can consider, we need to capture one of the Rebel Auto-ships to study. Could you do us a favor and hunt one of them down?"

"Excellent. We've attached the co-ordinates of the ship we'd like to study, but it's located too close to an ASB. If you could lure it away without causing too much damage we'll be able to send in a ship to collect it."

choice.text: (Capt. A55) Have A55 transfer Auto-ship data.

event.text: "Oh my, this is marvelous! This will help speed up our development greatly."

choice.text: (Engineer) Have your engineer transfer Auto-ship data.

event.text: "Oh my, this is marvelous! This will help speed up our development greatly."

choice.text: (Cognitive) Have your Cognitive transfer Auto-ship data.

event.text: "Oh my, this is marvelous! This will help speed up our development greatly."
"Understandable. Good luck with whatever mission you're on then."

choice.text: We have more important things to do than eavesdropping.

event.text: Whatever they're talking about, it doesn't matter to you. You ignore the Militia ships.

event.name: MILITIA_AUTOSEARCH_QUEST
event.text: You've discovered the Automated vessel mentioned by the Militiamen. In the distance you can see the ASB satellite swerving towards you.

choice.text: (Signal Diluter) Disable the Satellite's targeting systems.

event.text: The satellite stops turning immediately, unable to detect your location anymore. You'll still have to lure away the Auto, but now you can do so without the added risk of the ASB.

You launch several flares close to the satellite, confusing its targeting system. Considering how small the discs are you doubt the satellite will be able to destroy them easily, giving you enough time to lure away this ship.
Just as the militiamen warned, the ASB locks onto your precise location and begins firing immediately. Hopefully we don't take too much damage before the Auto flees.

event.name: MILITIA_AUTOSEARCH_LURE
event.text: You've successfully lured the Auto-ship away from the beacon. You prepare to follow the ship to its next destination.

event.name: MILITIA_AUTOSEARCH_QUEST_2
event.text: You have tracked down the Auto-ship once again. Nearby are the Militia vessels from earlier, already inspecting the Auto-ship.
"Ah, very good job. The ship is still in working condition, marvelous! Here is your pay, of course."

As you prepare to leave, you overhear shouting from the Militiamen. You turn around to see the Auto-ship has activated once again, and blasts one of the Militia ships to destruction! It moves on to attack you next.

choice.text: (Upg. Hacking) Disable the Auto-ship before it can cause more damage.

event.text: You shut down the Auto-ship immediately. The crew of the destroyed ship evacuate immediately, and only a few lives are lost. The Militiamen thank you.

event.name: MILITIA_DETECTIVE
event.text: 근처에 있는 민간 연료 보급 정거장에 민병대 함선 몇척이 정박해 있었습니다.
민병대원 하나가 당신이 정거장에 정박한것에 항의했지만 녹색 옷을 입고 옛 지구제 파이프를 문 사내한테 제지당했습니다. "아, 멀티버스 여행자신가? 나는 셜록 헤인즈라네. 지구 출신이다만 그 이후로는 민병대에 가담하고 있지. 지금은 SDM에서 탐정으로 일하고 있는데, 좀 곤란한 사건을 접하게 되어서 말이야. 혹시 좀 도와줄 수 있겠나?"

"물론 수수께끼를 말이지! 지난밤에 바로 이 정거장에서 헨리 콜먼이라는 사람이 총에 맞아 죽었네. 우리는 그가 반군의 음모에 관한 중요한 정보를 가지고 있었기 때문에 암살당했다고 추측하고 있네. 이 시설에는 헨리를 포함해 총 네 명이 근무하고 있었네. 범행이 일어난 후에는 세 명이 되었지. 중요한 건 살인 사건이 발생한 이후 24시간 동안 어떤 함선도 이곳에 정박하지 않았다는 것인데, 이것이 의미하는건 오직 하나뿐이지."
"간단한 것 아니겠나... 아무개 씨. 이것이 의미하는 것은 바로 세 명의 생존자 중 하나가 반군의 스파이라는 것이야! 문제는 그게 누구냐는 것이지. 현실을 넘나드는 형씨, 나를 도와 이 사건을 해결해보겠나?
"아주 훌륭하군! 아직 조사가 끝나진 않았다만 도움이 필요하다면 언제든 나에게 얘기하게. 용의자는 '톰 니콜슨'씨, '에이미 셰퍼드'씨 '다니엘 브라운'박사 이렇게 셋이라네. 자네의 추리를 기대해 보겠네!"
"이거 아쉽게 됐군. 그럼 나는 이만 가보겠네, 조사에 집중할 시간이 필요하거든."
여기서 무언가 중요한 사건이 있었던 게 확실합니다만, 당신과 관계 있는 일은 아닙니다.

event.name: DETECTIVE_EVIDENCE_MENU
event.text: 당신은 정거장 로비에 서서 주변을 살펴봤습니다. [정해진 순서 없이 원하는 만큼 조사할 수 있습니다.]
누구에게 말을 거시겠습니까?
정거장엔 여러 시스템이 설치되어 있었습니다. 어디를 조사하시겠습니까?
셜록이 눈썹을 치켜올렸습니다. "결론이 난 것 같나? 누가 헨리 씨를 쐈을까? [말을 걸어본 용의자만 고발할 수 있습니다]

choice.text: 누구도 헨리 씨를 직접 죽이지 않았습니다. 최후의 일격을 날린건 바로 대인 드론입니다!
어, 아닙니다. 좀 더 조사를 해야할 것 같습니다.

event.text: 셜록이 쿡쿡 웃었습니다. "잘 알겠네. 천천히 해도 된다네, 신중해서 나쁠 거 없지."

event.name: DETECTIVE_CORPSE
event.text: 당신은 헨리의 시체에 다가갔습니다. 시체에 자상은 없었지만, 등 뒤에 커다란 화상 자국이 있었습니다. 이건 블래스터에 의한게 분명하지만, 일반적인 휴대용 블래스터가 일으켰다기엔 크기가 너무 큽니다.

event.name: DETECTIVE_ACCUSE_SHERLOCK
event.text: 당신은 용의자들에게 다가서며 이리저리 기웃거리다가 마침내 셜록을 가리켰습니다. "자네 지금 날 의심하는 건가? 나는 사건 발샐 후에 여기 처음 왔다는 걸 알고 있지 않나?
갑자기 정거장의 불이 모두 꺼지고 블래스터의 격발음이 방에 울려퍼지면서 선원 한 명이 쓰러지는 소리가 들렸습니다. 불이 다시 켜졌을 땐 용의자들과 지원 병력은 모두 도망가고 없었습니다. 셜록이 외쳣습니다 "젠장! 진짜 혐의자가 도망쳐 버렸어! 이 장소는 이제 안전하지 않으니 빨리 떠나게!"

removeCrew.text: 당신을 죽은 선원의 상태를 확인하기 위해 클론실을 확인했지만, 이미 살인마가 한 발 앞서 바이러스를 설치해 클론 생성을 막았 놓았습니다! 바이러스는 제거했지만, 선원은 영영 돌아올 수 없게 되었습니다.

event.name: DETECTIVE_ACCUSE_DRONE
event.text: 셜록은 다른 용의자들 만큼이나 놀란 표정을 지었습니다. "흠, 드론이라고? 정말 흥미로운 생각이군! 하지만 그 이전에 누군가 드론을 조종하고 있었을 것이야. 그 자는 누구일 것 같나?"

당신이 다니엘을 지목하자 그는 놀란 표정을 지었습니다. 셜록이 고개를 끄덕였습니다. "그래, 브라운 박사는 이곳의 수석 엔지니어니 의심가는 용의자라 할 수 있지. 하지만, 그는 드론을 조작할 수 없었을 걸세! 생명 유지 장치를 조사하고 다니엘 박사와 이야기해 봤다면 알겠지만 그는 지난밤에 산소실을 개선하느라 현장에 없었다네. 산소실 개선 작업이 아주 오래 걸리는걸 감안하면 그 작업과 헨리 씨를 살해하는 일을 동시에 할 순 없었을 거야."

choice.text: 다니엘은 알리바이가 있습니다. 그는 범인이 아닙니다.

event.text: 에이미의 눈빛이 더욱 어두워졌습니다. 셜록은 그의 머리를 흔들었습니다. "아니, 셰퍼드 씨는 그런 일을 벌일 수가 없네. 그녀는 드론을 만져본 경험이 없어. 헨리 씨를 죽일 수 있을 만큼 오랫동안 드론을 조종하지 못할 것이야.
톰의 눈이 휘둥그레졌습니다. "뭐, 뭐라고요? 아니, 저일 리가 없어요! 전 드론에 대해 아무것도 모른다고요!" 그의 느긋하던 시골 억양은 간데없고 목소리가 불안해졌습니다.
셜록이 고개를 치켜들었습니다. 당신은 살인이 일어나기 얼마 전에 톰이 다니엘에게 드론 조종을 배운 일을 설명했습니다. 셜록은 당신의 추리에 감탄했습니다. 자네 말이 맞군. 세상에, 이건 나도 생각 못했는데!"
셜록이 끄덕였습니다. "아니, 톰 씨는 아니야. 이 정거장의 수석 엔지니어는 톰 씨가 아니라 다니엘 박사라네. 톰 씨는 헨리 씨를 죽일 수 있을 만큼 오랫동안 드론을 조종하지 못할 것이야."
셜록이 당신을 노려봤습니다. "누가 그랬는지도 모르는 상태에서 함부로 추측해서는 안되네! 계속 조사해 보게."

event.name: DETECTIVE_ACCUSE_THOM
event.text: 당신이 톰을 지목하자 그의 눈이 휘둥그레졌습니다. 셜록이 자리에서 일어나 당신에게 걸어옵니다. "정말 흥미로운 생각이야. 하지만 헨리 씨의 상흔을 보면 범행 도구는 평범한 블래스터가 아님을 알 수 있네. 니콜슨 씨가 가지고 있는 건 표준적인 호신용 권총밖에 없었어. 이 정거장에서 그런 상흔을 남길 수 있는 건 대인 드론밖에 없는데, 니콜슨 씨는 드론을 조작해본 경험이 없지.

event.name: DETECTIVE_ACCUSE_DANIEL
event.text: 다니엘은 자신이 지목당했다는 사실에 기분이 상한 것 같습니다. 셜록이 자리에서 일어나 당신에게 걸어옵니다. 정말 흥미로운 생각이야. 하지만 다니엘 씨는 사건 당일에 자기 할일이 바빴을 걸세. 생명 유지 장치를 조사하고 브라운 박사와 이야기 해 봤다면 알겠지만 그는 산소실을 개선하느라 밤새 바빴네. 드론을 조종해서 헨리 씨를 죽일 시간은 없었을 거야.

event.name: DETECTIVE_WRONG
event.text: 갑자기 정거장의 불이 모두 꺼지고 블래스터의 격발음이 방에 울려퍼지면서 선원 한 명이 쓰러지는 소리가 들렸습니다. 불이 다시 켜졌을 땐 용의자들과 지원 병력은 모두 도망가고 없었습니다. 셜록이 외쳣습니다 "젠장! 진짜 혐의자가 도망쳐 버렸어! 이 장소는 이제 안전하지 않으니 빨리 떠나게!"

event.name: DETECTIVE_TALK_THOM
event.text: 톰에게 무엇을 물어보시겠습니까?
톰은 본인의 삶에 대해 대강 늘어놓았습니다. 그는 작은 지구 행성에서 농부로 일했었지만 어느 날 락맨 크루세이더가 그의 고향에 불을 질렀습니다. 갈 곳이 없어진 그는 민병대에 입대해 다른 사람들이 자신과 같은 비극을 경험하지 않도록 민간인 구역을 보호하는데 힘쓰기로 했습니다.
톰은 고개를 절레절레 흔들었습니다. "어..없습니다 나리. 살면서 반군은 많이 만나 봤지만 그들과 친구가 된 적은 없었습니다. 저는 언제나 충성스러운 연방의 시민이었습니다."
"필수 시스템을 관리합니다. 제가 농사를 지었을 때 여러 장비를 다루는 방법을 배웠는데, 그때의 경험이 우주 정거장 관리에도 비슷하게 적용된다는 사실에 놀랐지요! 그래서 저는 방어막과 생명 유지 설비의 유지 관리를 돕고 무언가가 고장 났을 때 상점에서 새 부품을 사는 일을 하고 있습죠."
"저는 사실 헨리와 별로 대화를 해본 적이 없습니다. 항상 조용하고 내성적인 친구였거든요. 그래도 그 친구가 죽었다고 생각하니... 기분이 이상하네요."
어떤 용의자에 대해 물어보시겠습니까?
"에이미요? 그사람 참 특이한 사람이었죠. 항상 우리한테 뭐라 지껄여댔고, 제가 봐본 사람중에 가장 화를 잘 내는 사람이었어요. 그래도 자기가 맡은 일은 잘 하는 사람이었고, 살인을 할거라는 생각은 잘 안든단 말입니다! 그렇지만, 그녀가 헨리를 별로 안좋아 하기는 했습니다."
"브라운 박사님이요? 정말로 친절한 노인이시고, 자기 일에 열정적이시죠. 아마 이 살인사건에 꽤나 충격을 받으셨을 겁니다. 불쌍한 헨리랑 항상 가깝게 지내셨으니..."
당신은 아무 이유 없이 톰의 얼굴에 침을 뱉었습니다. 셜록이 당신을 노려봤지만 아무 말도 하지 않았습니다.
어떤 증거에 대해 물어보시겠습니까? [더 많은 단서나 증거물을 조가할수록 선택지가 늘어납니다]
"모르겠습니다. 드론같은거 이해할정도로 머리가 좋지 않거든요. 전적으로 브라운 박사님께 맡기고 있지요. 전 드론을 어떻게 작동 시키는지 조차도 모른단 말입니다!"
"영상이 없다구요? 그거 큰일이네요. 근데 형씨은 탐정이니까 영상 없어도 범인이 누군지 찾을수 있지요? 그렇지요?"
"음, 그건 좀 이상하네요. 제가 업그레이드를 한게 아니거든요. 살인사건이 일어난 지난 밤에 너무 바빴던 나머지 산소실을 확인하진 못했습니다. 하지만 그저께까지는 1 레밸이었던 건 분명합니다.

event.name: DETECTIVE_TALK_THOM_LIE
event.text: 당신은 다니엘이 드론 작동 방법을 배우던 톰에 대해 언급했다는 사실을 지적했습니다. 톰은 무슨 말을 해야 할지 몰라 말을 더듬었습니다. 더이상 추궁하지는 않았지만, 이 반응은 기억해 둘만 합니다.

event.name: DETECTIVE_TALK_AMY
event.text: 에이미에게 무엇을 물어보시겠습니까?
에이미는 그녀가 왜 민병대에 지원했는지에 대해서 별 말을 해주지 않았습니다. 단지 고향 행성에서 도망쳐 나올 수 있고 어쩌면 해적을 소탕할 수도 있는 좋은 방법이라고 생각했다고 합니다.
에이미는 생전에 반드시 당신을 후려갈기겠다는 양 노려보았습니다. "그런 비열한 자식들하고 저를 연관 짓다니요! 전 반군 따위 된 적 없고, 앞으로도 없을 거에요! 끝."
"저 빌어먹을 대인 드론을 장만하기 전까지는 침입자가 있나 순찰하는 일을 했어요. 그때는 매일같이 해적놈들을 혼쭐내줬지만, 망할 무기실로 발령받고 나서는 하루종일 버튼이나 누루고 앉아 있다고요!"
"헨리요? 하, 이곳에 있는지도 모르는 경우가 태반이었어요. 정말 괴짜였죠, 식사하거나 물마실 때 아니면 항상 자기 방에 틀어박혀 있었으니. 참 안타깝게도 그가 죽어도 이 정거장에서의 삶은 전혀 바뀌지 않아요. 여기 정말 지루해 죽을 것 같거든요."
어떤 용의자에 대해 물어보시겠습니까?
"톰은 정말 호구같은 사람이에요. 항상 여기서의 삶이 얼마나 좋은지 지껄이고 앉았죠. 제가 말했듯이, 이 정거장에 살면서 좋은건 아무것도 없어요! 어쨌든... 톰이 누군가를 죽인다? 상상할 수 없는 일이에요... 그가 연기에 정말 뛰어나지 않고서는 말이죠.
"그 영감탱이요? 당장이라도 먼지로 변할 것만 같은 사람이에요! 항상 그 늙은이를 그가 만지작거리는 드론만큼이나 재미없는 인간이라고 생각했어요. 어쩌면 그게 헨리랑 잘 지낸 이유일지도 모르겠네요."
당신은 아무 이유 없이 에이미의 얼굴에 침을 뱉었습니다. 셜록이 당신을 노려봤지만 아무 말도 하지 않았습니다.
어떤 증거에 대해 물어보시겠습니까? [더 많은 단서나 증거물을 조가할수록 선택지가 늘어납니다]
"드론들 말인가요? 한번도 건들여 본적 없어요. 저 망할 로봇이 제게서 해적 죽이는 임무를 뺐았아 갔다고요! '만약' 제가 살인자라면 헨리 대신 이 대인 드론을 박살냈을거에요. 어차피 고통도 못느끼는 고철덩어리들인데..."
"그럼 녹화 영상이 없다던가 뭐 그런거네요. 어차피 탐정님들은 영상 없이도 범인을 알아낼 수 있는거 아닌가요? 제가 그거에 대해서 뭘 말해드려야 할지 모르겠네요."
"전 생명 유지 장치에 대해선 아무것도 몰라요. 그건 전부 톰이 맡던 것이었어요, 제가 아니라고요."

event.name: DETECTIVE_TALK_DANIEL
event.text: 다니엘에게 무엇을 물어보시겠습니까?
"나 말이오? 그냥 늙은이일 뿐이네. 수년간 드론 기술을 공부하고 아카디아에서 엔지니어로 일했었네만, 지금은 은퇴했소. 하지만... 놀고먹는 건 내 적성에 맞지 않더군. 그래서 어딘 해변가의 집에서 썩어가는 대신 민병대에 가담하는 것을 선택했소."

다니엘은 자기 발치를 내려다봤습니다. "반군이었던 적은 없지만, 함께 일한 경험은 있네. 아카디아에서 근무하고 있을 때 지금은 "프리 로머"사건으로 더 잘 알려진 "중앙 정보 전투 보조원 (Central Intelligence Combat Assistant)", 줄여서 CICA 프로젝트의 책임자였던 적이 있소. 이건 반군이 무인기 함대를 구축하는데 사용된 AI였는데, 그렇게 악랄한 일에 사용될 줄은 모르고 있었지. 내가 개발한 기술이 어떻게 사용되었는지 깨닫고는 바로 은퇴했네."
"나는 선상 엔지니어라네. 드론 관제실과 대인 드론을 설치하도록 다른 선원들을 설득하는데 성공한 이후로 이들을 관리하고 있지."
"오, 가엾은 헨리. 정말 착한 사람이었지. 나는 그의 숙소에서 같이 점심을 먹곤 했소. 다른 사람들이 헨리와 친해질 수 없었다는게 안타까울 따름이오. 워낙 내성적인 친구라. 헨리... 어떻게 자네에게 이런 비극이..."
어떤 용의자에 대해 물어보시겠습니까?
"톰은 착한 친구요. 헨리만큼 막역한 사이는 아니지만 자주 이야기를 나눴는데, 항상 즐거운 사내지. 최근에는 톰이 드론 시스템에 관심을 보이더니 드론 조종하는 걸 도와달라고 했소! 꽤나 빠르게 배우고 있긴 하지만, 나에게 무언가 일을 시키려고 배우는거 같다는 느낌도 들긴 하오. 나는 언제나 제자를 두고 싶었지..."

"나도 그 친구만큼 열정을 가졌으면 하오. 젊었을 때도 그 친구만큼 활기차지는 못했지. 그 에너지를 몽땅 우리한테 윽박지르느라 낭비하는 게 안타까울 따름이오. 그녀가 무기 관제실에 배정되고 부터는 자기 자신에게 불평불만을 늘어놓으면서 하루를 보내니 망정이지. 누구를 딱 지목하고 싶지는 않지만, 우리 셋 중에 누군가가 다른 이를 죽일 정도로 저열해졌다면 아마도 그녀일 거라 생각하오..."
당신은 아무 이유 없이 다니엘의 얼굴에 침을 뱉었습니다. 셜록이 당신을 노려봤지만 아무 말도 하지 않았습니다.
어떤 증거에 대해 물어보시겠습니까? [더 많은 단서나 증거물을 조가할수록 선택지가 늘어납니다]
"센서가 작동하지 않는다고? 그거 참 안좋은 소식이군. 그렇지만 영상이 없더라도 범인을 찾아낼 방법이 분명 있을거요!"

event.name: DETECTIVE_TALK_DANIEL_EVIDENCE_OXYGEN
event.text: "맞아요, 내 작품이오! 톰은 주로 필수 시설을 관리하지만, 어제는 드론을 관리해줘서 제가 할일이 없었소. 그래서 오랜만에 솜씨 발휘해서 산소실을 업그레이드 했지. 헤..헨리는 항상 환기가 잘 안된다고 불평했거든..."

event.name: DETECTIVE_TALK_DANIEL_EVIDENCE_DRONE
event.text: "아 그렇지, 물론이오! 모든 함선과 정거장은 드론 장비가 있어야 비로소 완성되는 것이오. 난 주로 드론을 다루면서 시간을 보냈소. 톰 녀석이 내게 드론 조종법을 배우겠다고 부탁한 뒤로는 그 애도 여기서 시간을 보내는 일이 잦아졌지."

event.name: DETECTIVE_SYSTEM_DOORS
event.text: 당신은 문 제어실을 조사했습니다. 방폭문 개량 작업이 이루어졌던 것 같지만, 이번 사건과 연관은 없어 보입니다. 피해자와 용의자들 모두가 시스템 데이터베이스에 등록돼 있기 때문에 정거장 어디든 자유롭게 돌아다닐 수 있었을 것입니다.

event.name: DETECTIVE_SYSTEM_DRONES
event.text: 당신은 드론 관제실을 살펴봤습니다. 정거장의 컴퓨터에 그리 많은 설계도는 없었지만, 대인 전투 드론과 제식 전투 드론의 도면은 확인할 수 있었습니다.
전투 드론의 도식은 드론 시스템이 설치된 이후로 단 3번만 사용된 듯 합니다. 데이터 조사 결과 드론 관제실을 구입할 때 같이 딸려온 제품인 것 같습니다.
컴퓨터에 의하면 이 대인 전투 드론은 구매 이후 총 38번이나 사용되었다고 합니다. 이 구역에 밀려오는 해적들의 수를 생각하면, 정거장에 강습해오는 해적도 불합리할 정도로 많았을 테니 별로 놀라운 숫자는 아닙니다.

event.name: DETECTIVE_DRONE_CANNON
event.text: 당신은 대인 전투 드론의 레이저를 조사했습니다. 놀랍게도 팔에 장착된 레이저포는 표준적인 방어용 블래스터보다 훨씬 강력해 보입니다. 이거라면 분명 헨리의 시체에 발견된 커다란 화상 자국을 남길 수 있을 것입니다!

event.name: DETECTIVE_SYSTEM_SHIELDS
event.text: 당신은 방어막 제어실을 조사했습니다. 이곳의 기기들은 모두 제 기능을 하고 있으며 이상한 점은 없어 보입니다.

event.name: DETECTIVE_SYSTEM_OXYGEN
event.text: 당신은 산소실을 조사했습니다. 보통의 경우보다 더 잘 작동하는 것처럼 보이고 완전 새것 같은 상태입니다. 보아하니 최근에 업그레이드된 것 같습니다.

event.name: DETECTIVE_SYSTEM_SENSORS
event.text: 당신은 센서실을 조사했습니다. 누군가 컴퓨터를 망가뜨리고 살인사건 당일 밤의 모든 녹화자료를 지워버린 듯합니다! 더 이상 쓸모 있어보있는 구석은 없지만, 누군가가 이런 짓을 저질렀겠죠...

event.name: DETECTIVE_SYSTEM_WEAPONS
event.text: 당신은 무기 제어실을 조사했습니다. 에이미의 이름표가 붙여진 작은 가방과 여러가지 잡동사니들이 방에 널브러져 있습니다. 여기가 그녀의 주 근무지인듯 합니다.

event.name: DETECTIVE_CORRECT
event.text: 톰은 더 이상 빠져나갈 수 없음을 인지하고 떨리는 손으로 급하게 블래스터를 집으려 했지만, 셜록이 무릎을 쏴 그를 제지했습니다. 다른 민병대원들은 재빨리 톰을 구속하고 에이미와 다니엘을 대피시켰습니다. 셜록이 총을 집어넣고 당신에게 감사를 표합니다. "아주 잘했네! 이제 이 사건의 진상을 알아낼 시간이네."

톰은 셜록의 함선에 넘겨져 빈 방에 있는 의자에 묶였습니다. "그래서 자네가 반군 스파이인가? 톰은 포박을 풀려고 몸을 뒤척였지만 이내 포기했습니다. "너희는 절대로 이해 못해! 내가 알던 사람들... 내 가족, 내 친구들.. 전부 락맨한테 죽었단 말이야! 이러고도 외계인들이 인류의 적이 아니라고 할 수 있어? 그리고 락맨이 우리를 공격하는 동안 연방은 뭘 하고 있었지? 자기 시민들도 지키지 못하는 연방이 뭐가 그리 위대하냐고!"
셜록은 맞은 편 의자에 다리를 꼬고 앉았습니다. "그래서 복수를 하기 위해 반군에 가담했나?" 톰이 고개를 끄덕였습니다. "반군은 연방이 이루지 못할 우주를 만들어 줄거라고! 인류가 응당 누려야 할 우주를!"
셜록이 비웃으며 말했습니다. "좋아, 호소는 그쯤 해두게. 우리가 알고 싶은 건 네가 그렇게 지키려던 정보가 다니까 말이야. 톰은 침을 삼켰습니다. "절대 말 안해!"

당신은 톰의 얼굴을 가격했습니다. "그, 그래 말할게! 나는 이 구역을 감시하라고 보내진 잠복 요원이야. 얼마 전에 반군은 이 구역을 침공해서 민병대의 격납고와 무기고를 장악하려는 계획을 세웠어. 오늘이 바로 그 계획이 실행되는 날이야! 그리고 반군 스파이는 나 혼자만이 아니야, 나랑 같이 정거장에 배치된 헨리도 스파이였어. 하지만 녀석은 그 늙은이랑 너무 친해졌다고. 박사를 포함한 이곳의 모든 사람들이 위험에 빠진다는 걸 깨닫고는 마음이 약해져서 계획을 까발리려고 했어. 내가 그 겁쟁이 자식을 죽여서 계획이 '안전'해진 거야!

"퍽이나 '안전'하겠군, 방금 자기 입으로 계획을 다 까발린 주제에 말야." 셜록은 민병대 경비병에게 손짓하여 톰의 입을 막고 방에서 내보내도록 했습니다. "제길.. 만약 이 정보가 사실이라면 우린 정말 심각한 상황에 놓인걸세. 당장 이 사실을 중앙 격납고에 가서 민병대 장교에게 알려야 하네! 자네의 함선이 내 것보다 훨씬 빨라 보이니 잠깐 좀 얻어타도록 하겠네."

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: 방어막 생성기가 정지하기까지 남은 시간입니다. 이 안에 반드시 전함을 무찌르십시오.

destroyed.text: 전함이 폭발하면서 주변 일대가 잔해로 뒤덮였고 몇몇 함선은 잔해에 맞아 격추되었습니다. 다행히도 반응로는 폭발에 별 피해를 입지 않았습니다.

deadCrew.text: 전함의 선원들이 몰살당했습니다. 전함이 행성 표면으로 추락하자 몇몇 함선이 들이박혀 같이 격추당했습니다. 다행히도 반응로는 충격 별 피해를 입지 않았습니다.

event.name: DETECTIVE_HANGARATTACK
event.text: 너무 늦은듯 합니다. 이미 반군이 침공을 개시한 것 같습니다. 저 멀리에 거대한 민병대 함선이 아군에게 사격을 가하는 것이 보이는데, 이것이 의미하는 건 오직 하나 뿐이죠. 반군이 이미 함선을 탈취했고, 공격을 주도할 용도로 사용 하고 있습니다!

민병대 장교가 대답했습니다. "좋아, 우린 지금 어떤 도움이라도 절실히 필요하네! 반군 함선 두 대가 방어막 생성기를 가동시키기 전에 침입했지만, 지금은 어떻게든 생성기를 가동시켰네. 하지만 반군이 생성기에 큰 손상을 입혔고 저 빌어먹을 전함이 마무리를 지으려 하고 있어. 얼마 안가 방어막이 해제되면 우린 다 끝장이야! 만약 저 전함을 파괴하거나 나포할 수 있다면 생성기를 수리하고 반군 함대를 내쫓을 수 있을 것이네!"
당신은 추진기를 가동하여 방어막 생성기를 포격중이던 전함을 가로막았습니다. 빠르게 결판을 지어야 합니다!
당신은 제한된 시간을 가지고 저런 함선과 싸우는 것이 별로 내키지 않았습니다. 당신은 엔진을 가동하고 가능한 빨리 이곳을 떠나기 위해 준비했습니다.

event.text: 당신의 등 뒤에서 거대한 폭발이 일어났습니다. 푸른 광선이 거대한 방어막 생성기를 집어삼켰고 기지 전체를 잿더미로 만들어버렸습니다! 당신은 임무에 실패했습니다. 방어막이 비활성화되자마자 전함은 도약해 없어졌고 반군 함대가 물밀듯 밀려들었습니다.
간신히 대다수의 함선을 피했지만, 선체에 미사일 몇발을 직격당했고 근처의 드랍십으로부터 병사 몇명이 침입했습니다. 민병대의 전망은 암울해 졌지만 그래도 최악의 사태는 모면했습니다...

event.name: DETECTIVE_HANGARATTACK_DESTROY
event.text: 생성기를 파괴할 전함이 사라지자 함대는 방어막에 갇혀 아무것도 하지 못했습니다. 잠시 후 민병대 증원군이 도착해 전세가 빠르게 뒤집혔고 엔지니어 팀이 곧바로 수복 작업을 시작했습니다. 반군측 증원군도 도착했지만 격납고로 진입할 방법이 없음을 깨닫고는 방어막에 하염없이 사격을 가했지만 이내 헛수고라는 것을 깨달은 모양입니다.
